ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Would recommend the class for anyone who wants more than a passing surface-level understanding of microfinance. Definitely good for people interested in the deep minutiae of how it all works and also interested in a career in microfinance in the future.

Excellent course for anyone interested in microfinance specifically or impact investing generally (since microfinance comprises a huge percentage of the impact investing industry, which is something I learned from Prof. Sheldon).

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Addition insight into an area of development economics but unlikely to have direct professional application.
Deepened my knowledge quite a bit!
